prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing movie ratings:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "MovieID": ["M01", "M02", "M03", "M04", "M05", "M06"],
    "Title": ["Inception", "The Dark Knight", "Pulp Fiction", "Forrest Gump", "The Matrix", "Interstellar"],
    "Genre": ["Sci-Fi", "Action", "Crime", "Drama", "Sci-Fi", "Sci-Fi"],
    "Year": [2010, 2008, 1994, 1994, 1999, 2014],
    "Rating": [8.8, 9.0, 8.9, 8.8, 8.7, 8.6],
    "Votes": [2200000, 2500000, 1900000, 1800000, 1700000, 1600000]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Filter the DataFrame to include only movies with a "Genre" of "Sci-Fi". 2) For these Sci-Fi movies, calculate and print the average "Rating". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, filter for Sci-Fi movies, and accurately calculate their average rating.
